result.execSummary:
The defendant William F Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William F Hart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William F Hart was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • William F Hart was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Deft is sentenced to 10 days work crew.  To report to work crew on 1/29/16 @ 8am.  In default of work crew, 10 days KCJ.
Costs rolled into sentence.

Deft sentenced to consecutive 5 days work crew.  
In default of work crew, 5 days KCJ.
Costs rolled into sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William F Hart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Satisfaction of court order. Completed work crew for mandatory sentence.
Signed up for work crew per judge's order for mandatory sentence.
Email sent to Deputy Jeff Marsh re: work crew sentence

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Bielski.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  

Count 2 - deft sentenced to 10 days work crew; instructed to report to work crew on 1/29/16 @ 8am.  In default of work crew, 10 days KCJ.  Costs rolled into sentence

Count 3 - deft sentenced to consecutive 5 days work crew.  In default of work crew, 5 days KCJ.  Costs rolled into sentence

Appeal rights
DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Fred Zievers on behalf of Atty Donald Bielski.  Atty Bielski not available today due to family emergency.  FPT adj to 1/28/16 @ 9:30am, JS 2/15/16 @ 9am.  Attys report the case is very likely to settle.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person.  Atty Bielski appeared 20min late.  Defense requests an adjournment; has add'l information he needs to provide to the State.  Case to be left on for JS for 11/30/15 @ 9am.  Parties will have until 5pm on 11/24/15 to settle the case.  NO plea bargaining will be allowed after that date.

Defendant, William F Hart, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for William F Hart
Current: 22345 North Avenue, Antioch, IL 60002 United States  (Effective: 08-13-2015)
Prior: 12514 234th Avenue, Trevor, WI 53179

124 p.m.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Donald Bielski.  Clk  NJurgens.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  8/27/ @  a.m.  $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug para.
